required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intramyocardial Delivery of Autologous Bone Marrow
clinical_study.official_title: Intramyocardial Delivery of Autologous Bone Marrow

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized study to assess the safety, feasibility and effectiveness of direct intramyocardial percutaneous delivery of autologous bone marrow-derived total mononuclear cells or selected CD34+ cells in patients with refractory angina pectoris.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Endpoint: Incidence of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) at 30 days. MACE is defined as a combined endpoint of death, acute MI (Q-wave and non-Q wave), revascularization procedures (percutaneous or surgical), and peri-procedural complications (that is, left ventricular perforation with hemodynamic consequences requiring pericardiocentesis, and stroke).
Incidence of MACE at 3, 6 and 12 months
Secondary Endpoints:
- Change in Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS) angina classification score from baseline to 12 months
- Changes in the quality of life, as assessed according to the Seattle Angina Questionnaire
- Change in exercise duration and exercise tolerance using standardized treadmill exercise testing from baseline, to 6 months and to 12 months
- Cumulative number of hospitalizations for coronary ischemia and congestive heart failure at 12 months following treatment.
- SPECT-chances in global and regional radionuclide perfusion at rest, peak stress, and redistribution for baseline to 1, 6 and 12 months
- Change in angiographic collateral score at 6 months
- Change in global and regional myocardial contractility (assessed by echocardiography) at baseline, 6 and 12 months.

clinical_study.why_stopped: No more funding support for additional procedures

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of major adverse cardiac events (MACE), defined as a combined endpoint of death, acute MI (Q-wave and non-Q wave), revascularization procedures and peri-procedural complications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS) angina classification score
Changes in the quality of life, as assessed according to the Seattle Angina Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1,3,6,12 months and every year for 8 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in exercise duration and exercise tolerance using standardized treadmill exercise testing
Cumulative number of hospitalizations for coronary ischemia and congestive heart failure
SPECT-chances in global and regional radionuclide perfusion at rest, peak stress, and redistribution
Change in global and regional myocardial contractility (assessed by echocardiography)

arm_group.description: Intramyocardial injection of total mononuclear bone marrow derived cells

arm_group.arm_group_label: Selected CD34+ bone marrow derived cells
arm_group.description: Intramyocardial injection of selected CD34+ bone marrow derived cells

intervention.description: Direct intramyocardial percutaneous delivery of autologous bone marrow-derived total mononuclear cells or selected CD34+ cells
intervention.arm_group_label: Selected CD34+ bone marrow derived cells
intervention.other_name: Selected CD34+ bone marrow derived cells
